item.title: What no one tells you about PRDs
item.description: You may have heard of the infamous Product Requirements Document: the mysterious, magical, monolithic document that designers and engineers use to turn our ideas into a product or feature. We all wish it were that easy. Writing good PRDs is hard because there's no one right way to do it. Just like good PMs, your PRDs need to fit their own industry and organization. In the end, all PRDs have a commonality: they specify the requirements of a product or feature. And given those commonalities, here are three tips.It's all about context
